title: 10 Nordstrom Picks For Fall, From Shearling-Lined Clogs to a Sweater Vest
description: As shopping editors, we live for seasonal unveilings from our favorite brands and department stores. Nordstrom, our go-to retail destination for trend-forward pieces and investment-worthy classics, unrolled its fall inventory and it's stocked with PSL-weather gems. Not that anyone needs one, but Nordstrom's fall drop is the perfect excuse to add some cozier pieces to your wardrobe. Whether you're scouring the internet for the perfect fall wedding guest dress, pulling together a fall travel packing list, assembling a game day outfit, or just dopamine dressing, Nordstrom's inventory is exploding with inspiration, and we've curated standouts in a variety of categories. This season's offerings are packed with trends you can expect to see everywhere this fall. Be on the lookout for comfy clogs, sweater vests, wide-leg jeans, and more. Regardless of what you're shopping for this season, you're bound to find what you're looking for (and even some things you weren't) at Nordstrom. Keep reading to see our favorite fashion picks for fall that are worth grabbing while they're still in stock. Related: Nordstrom's Latest Fashion Collab Spotlights Black Culture
author: Angela Elias
excerpt: BRB, just adding these pieces to our shopping carts immediately.
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.As shopping editors, we live for seasonal unveilings from our favorite brands and department stores. Nordstrom, our go-to retail destination for trend-forward pieces and investment-worthy classics, unrolled its fall inventory and it's stocked with PSL-weather gems. Not that anyone needs one, but Nordstrom's fall drop is the perfect excuse to add some cozier pieces to your wardrobe. Whether you're scouring the internet for the perfect fall wedding guest dress, pulling together a fall travel packing list, assembling a game day outfit, or just dopamine dressing, Nordstrom's inventory is exploding with inspiration, and we've curated standouts in a variety of categories. This season's offerings are packed with trends you can expect to see everywhere this fall. Be on the lookout for comfy clogs, sweater vests, wide-leg jeans, and more. Regardless of what you're shopping for this season, you're bound to find what you're looking for (and even some things you weren't) at Nordstrom. Keep reading to see our favorite fashion picks for fall that are worth grabbing while they're still in stock. nordstrom.comBest Straight-Leg PantsHue Plaid Straight Leg Pull-On Pants ($58) When you need a break from your jeans and sweats, these pull-on pants will help you look polished without much effort. The plaid print is perfectly suited for fall, and we're already dreaming about the cute loafers and sweaters we could pair them with.nordstrom.comBest Sweater VestTopshop Thermal Stitch Sweater Vest ($68) This sweater vest looks amazing with bare arms and a gold necklace for warmer fall days but can easily transition into chillier weather when layered on top of a white T-shirt or long-sleeved blouse. Between the faux horn buttons and front pockets, it's giving just a hint of collegiate prep, and we're here for it.nordstrom.comBest Cropped SweaterOpen Edit Blousson Sweater ($70) When you want to wear a comfy sweater without looking like you're drowning in knitted fabric, this slightly cropped and subtle balloon-sleeved sweater will do the job. Throw it on with a pair of high-waisted cords or denim for a chic and cozy look.nordstrom.comBest Oversize SweaterFree People Frankie Cable Cotton Sweater ($74, originally $98) Pay homage to the season of fallen leaves, pumpkin spice lattes, and a drop in the temperature with a chunky, oversize sweater like this option from Free People. A modern twist on a classic fisherman sweater, we're all about the balloon sleeves and blown-up scale of the cable-knit pattern.PS Photography | Angela EliasBest Ballet FlatsMadewell The Greta Ballet Flat ($98) For buttery-soft ballet flats you'll live in this season, you'll want to get your feet into these shoes. The subtle square toe and Mary Jane-style strap make them feel current yet timeless. They come in several colors, including this chocolate raisin hue. Our editor tested them out and writes about her experience in this Madewell The Greta Ballet Flat review. Editor quote: "I've tried on many iterations of this style of ballet flat from a variety of brands and immediately noticed how the elastic straps would cut into the tops of my feet, or the way the back of the shoes would dig into my heels. With this shoe, they immediately felt comfortable and I didn't have to suffer through a breaking-in period." — Angela Elias, contributing editor, ShoppingPS Photography | Angela EliasBest Wide-Leg JeansMadewell Emmett Patch Pocket Wide Leg Jeans ($138) These high-waisted, wide-leg jeans are perfect for anyone looking for an on-trend style that can also stand the test of time. They're made from a stretchy material that helps make the high waist comfortable and the legs aren't overly baggy. Our editor tested them out and says that they "feel like shapewear" — in the best way. For more details, read this Madewell Emmett Patch Pocket Wide Leg Jeans review. Editor quote: "The material is mostly cotton with a smidge of recycled polyester and elastane, so they feel especially soft and stretchy. The top of the jeans hit just above my belly button and almost feel like shapewear. As a mom of two, I prefer high-waisted jeans that offer plenty of belly support without feeling like I'm counting down the minutes until I can unbutton them. They mold to my curves and I can squat, bend over, and run around all day without the dreaded droopiness that sometimes happens towards the end of the day." — AEPS Photography/ Angela EliasBest Cotton ToteClare V. Michel Crochet Cotton Tote ($165) This crochet cotton tote is perfectly in tune with this season's sporty prep vibe. Between the bold colors, stripes, and the fun "Le Vibe" graphic, it makes a statement, even when paired with a sweatsuit. Our editor tested it out and thinks it's the perfect casual tote. For more details, read this Clare V. Michel Crochet Cotton Tote review. Editor quote: "While it's technically the same material as my grocery store tote, it's crafted from supersoft crochet cotton, which gives it the most amazing texture. Unlike some woven bags that can be a little rough and scratchy, this one feels great on bare shoulders if you're wearing a tank top or against bare arms. The striped pattern and bold cobalt blue and poppy red colors make an eye-catching statement, but my favorite detail might be the 'Le Vibe' text across the side of the bag." — AEnordstrom.comBest ClogsBirkenstock Boston Genuine Shearling Lined Clog ($170) A coveted shoe, Birkenstock's Boston Clog is known to sell out. Even our editor can attest to its comfort and versatility — just read her detailed Birkenstock Boston Clog review to know the hype is real. So what could make this beloved clog even better? Shearling lining, of course. Soft and cozy, you can wear them barefoot or double the warmth and pair them with cute socks.nordstrom.comBest Knee-High BootsSam Edelman Sylvia Knee High Boot ($200-$250) Nothing makes us root harder for a skinny jean revival like a sleek and sexy pair of knee-high boots. Pair these suede beauties with all your skirts and dresses to make them fall-ready. You can choose from eight different colors in suede and leather.-Angela Elias is a contributing editor for PS Shopping. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments on TV Guide Network and video content for brands like Pier 1 and Walgreens. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

As shopping editors, we live for seasonal unveilings from our favorite brands and department stores. Nordstrom, our go-to retail destination for trend-forward pieces and investment-worthy classics, unrolled its fall inventory and it's stocked with PSL-weather gems. Not that anyone needs one, but Nordstrom's fall drop is the perfect excuse to add some cozier pieces to your wardrobe. Whether you're scouring the internet for the perfect fall wedding guest dress, pulling together a fall travel packing list, assembling a game day outfit, or just dopamine dressing, Nordstrom's inventory is exploding with inspiration, and we've curated standouts in a variety of categories.

This season's offerings are packed with trends you can expect to see everywhere this fall. Be on the lookout for comfy clogs, sweater vests, wide-leg jeans, and more. Regardless of what you're shopping for this season, you're bound to find what you're looking for (and even some things you weren't) at Nordstrom. Keep reading to see our favorite fashion picks for fall that are worth grabbing while they're still in stock.

Best Straight-Leg Pants

Hue Plaid Straight Leg Pull-On Pants ($58)

When you need a break from your jeans and sweats, these pull-on pants will help you look polished without much effort. The plaid print is perfectly suited for fall, and we're already dreaming about the cute loafers and sweaters we could pair them with.

Best Sweater Vest

Topshop Thermal Stitch Sweater Vest ($68)

This sweater vest looks amazing with bare arms and a gold necklace for warmer fall days but can easily transition into chillier weather when layered on top of a white T-shirt or long-sleeved blouse. Between the faux horn buttons and front pockets, it's giving just a hint of collegiate prep, and we're here for it.

Best Cropped Sweater

Open Edit Blousson Sweater ($70)

When you want to wear a comfy sweater without looking like you're drowning in knitted fabric, this slightly cropped and subtle balloon-sleeved sweater will do the job. Throw it on with a pair of high-waisted cords or denim for a chic and cozy look.

Best Oversize Sweater

Free People Frankie Cable Cotton Sweater ($74, originally $98)

Pay homage to the season of fallen leaves, pumpkin spice lattes, and a drop in the temperature with a chunky, oversize sweater like this option from Free People. A modern twist on a classic fisherman sweater, we're all about the balloon sleeves and blown-up scale of the cable-knit pattern.

Best Ballet Flats

Madewell The Greta Ballet Flat ($98)

For buttery-soft ballet flats you'll live in this season, you'll want to get your feet into these shoes. The subtle square toe and Mary Jane-style strap make them feel current yet timeless. They come in several colors, including this chocolate raisin hue. Our editor tested them out and writes about her experience in this Madewell The Greta Ballet Flat review.

Editor quote: "I've tried on many iterations of this style of ballet flat from a variety of brands and immediately noticed how the elastic straps would cut into the tops of my feet, or the way the back of the shoes would dig into my heels. With this shoe, they immediately felt comfortable and I didn't have to suffer through a breaking-in period." — Angela Elias, contributing editor, Shopping

Best Wide-Leg Jeans

Madewell Emmett Patch Pocket Wide Leg Jeans ($138)

These high-waisted, wide-leg jeans are perfect for anyone looking for an on-trend style that can also stand the test of time. They're made from a stretchy material that helps make the high waist comfortable and the legs aren't overly baggy. Our editor tested them out and says that they "feel like shapewear" — in the best way. For more details, read this Madewell Emmett Patch Pocket Wide Leg Jeans review.

Editor quote: "The material is mostly cotton with a smidge of recycled polyester and elastane, so they feel especially soft and stretchy. The top of the jeans hit just above my belly button and almost feel like shapewear. As a mom of two, I prefer high-waisted jeans that offer plenty of belly support without feeling like I'm counting down the minutes until I can unbutton them. They mold to my curves and I can squat, bend over, and run around all day without the dreaded droopiness that sometimes happens towards the end of the day." — AE

Best Cotton Tote

Clare V. Michel Crochet Cotton Tote ($165)

This crochet cotton tote is perfectly in tune with this season's sporty prep vibe. Between the bold colors, stripes, and the fun "Le Vibe" graphic, it makes a statement, even when paired with a sweatsuit. Our editor tested it out and thinks it's the perfect casual tote. For more details, read this Clare V. Michel Crochet Cotton Tote review.

Editor quote: "While it's technically the same material as my grocery store tote, it's crafted from supersoft crochet cotton, which gives it the most amazing texture. Unlike some woven bags that can be a little rough and scratchy, this one feels great on bare shoulders if you're wearing a tank top or against bare arms. The striped pattern and bold cobalt blue and poppy red colors make an eye-catching statement, but my favorite detail might be the 'Le Vibe' text across the side of the bag." — AE

Best Clogs

Birkenstock Boston Genuine Shearling Lined Clog ($170)

A coveted shoe, Birkenstock's Boston Clog is known to sell out. Even our editor can attest to its comfort and versatility — just read her detailed Birkenstock Boston Clog review to know the hype is real. So what could make this beloved clog even better? Shearling lining, of course. Soft and cozy, you can wear them barefoot or double the warmth and pair them with cute socks.

Best Knee-High Boots

Sam Edelman Sylvia Knee High Boot ($200-$250)

Nothing makes us root harder for a skinny jean revival like a sleek and sexy pair of knee-high boots. Pair these suede beauties with all your skirts and dresses to make them fall-ready. You can choose from eight different colors in suede and leather.

Angela Elias is a contributing editor for PS Shopping. In her former roles at PS, she led the relaunch of its Latine identity and family-focused verticals, directed its Home vertical, and hosted shopping segments on TV Guide Network and video content for brands like Pier 1 and Walgreens. She has nearly 15 years of experience working in the lifestyle space as a writer, editor, content strategist, director, on-camera talent, and publicist.
